page.title: 10Farm Survey
page.content: We did a survey about HOLT FARM to find out about life on a farm. In 1984 Mr Threlfall had 65 cows of which 40 were milked and each produced 1170 gallons of milk per year. 25 calves are too young to be milked and are raised on the farm until they are old enough for milking. Mr Threlfall also buys milk from local dairies as there is not enough from his cows. The cows are milked twice a day, at 06.30 and 17.00. On the farm Mr Threlfall also cuts grass for silage. He puts the grass under a black plastic sheet to keep it for the winter feed. A farmer works all through the year and does not go on many holidays because someone else has to look after the farm and the milk round.
